# Setting up GitHub Repository

# Create local repository

  1. Make sure that you are inside the project directory before running any git command.
cd C:/laragon/www/laravel-project
  1. To initialize a git repository, run:
git init
  1. Once the repository has been initialized, open GitHub Desktop to add a local repository. Click File >> Add a local repository and select the project folder.

  1. We can now add our initial commit:

  1. Once we have our first commit, we can now add three different branches (local, development, production)
  • local source code copy for local development
  • development source code copy dedicated for development server
  • production production ready code to be pulled on the production server

  1. We can now publish our repository to GitHub:

  1. We can now add collaborators to our project.
    1. Open Github Desktop
    2. Click View on GitHub
    3. Go to repository settings
    4. Click Collaborators
    5. Click Add people
    6. Search for the username of the collaborator
    7. Click Add collaborator to this repository
